title: Scotland's World Cup clash with Japan will go ahead as planned
text:
Scotland v Japan will go ahead later today in front of a full house of 75,000 fans after the Yokohama International Stadium passed an inspection following the devastating Typhoon Hagibis.

After days of bitter recrimination, Scotland will get their chance to play in what is effectively a straight shootout for a quarter-final place.

In a statement, World Rugby released on Sunday morning said: “The decision was taken following a comprehensive assessment of the venue and associated infrastructure on Sunday morning in partnership with the Host City. World Rugby and the Japan Rugby 2019 Organising Committee would like to thank everyone involved for their significant efforts to enable the match to...
description: Scotland v Japan will go ahead later today in front of a full house of 75,000 fans after the Yokohama International Stadium passed an inspection following the devastating Typhoon Hagibis.
